label: Description
value: Four-lobed foot with gadrooned C-scrolls and collar. Four-lobed column, fluted in lower part, with gadrooned collar. Urn-shaped candle holder with gadrooned four-lobed rim. Weighted.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Spreading domed foot on three balls. Flaring body in three sections with three rings attached to upper band, two of them with lozenge-shaped pendants (third missing). Lower section engraved with oval ornaments; middle section, engraved with hunting scene, the upper with three spread eagles and scrolls. Rim, foot and bands gilt.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 15 x 8 cm (5 7/8 x 3 1/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Necklace of gilt silver, made of two distinctly different designed parts. Lower part: seven 12-sided ridged globular units of filigree work and of graduating sizes. Connected by elongated bell-shaped unit to upper part of filigree braided links over circular, small-scaled units.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Monotone cameo-glass, ruby red; carved with eight precious emblems of good fortune; wheel of law, conch shell, umbrella canopy, lotus flower, pair of fish, endless knot. Flattened globose shape. Stopper of green glass simulating jade and set on pale red glass. Ivory spoon.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Linen center; lace border with the initials EGH, MHY, SCH, and AMY, and Italian place names worked in crocheted lace; edging of bobbin lace. This lace was crocheted and the tablecloth made by Miss Eleanor Hewitt after an Italian trip made by herself and her sisters with Mrs. A. Murray Young. The initials of the travellers are worked in the lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: crochet, bobbin lace

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Upper row, left: nearly nude man with bald head lays on a stone slab, at right, a cloaked man with his left hand upon a stone block and his head, right elbow on his right knee. Center, left: a gentleman, walking rests his right hand upon a walking stick. Below: a man, with his left hand in his pocket walks up stairs and gives something to a barefoot and bald man (who is probably a friar) in an overcoat, seen from the back.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Possibly Marquis de F.; John J. Peoli; Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
The Elevation of a Console Table

label: Description
value: Curved legs with women’s heads on top. Griffins flank a lyre on the ledge connecting the legs. Their tails end with rinceaux which rise along the legs. The frieze of the table top shows a frieze of palmettes and griffins.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and ink on light bluish paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A child sits in the middle ground upon a goat, with four other beside it. In the foreground kneels, at right, a child besides some objects which lie upon the ground. He is shown from the back. At left sits a child upon a block and blows a Pan's flute. In the background are: a tree with a cloth in its branches, a Paris hermae, an altar with a pitcher. Framing lines. Verso: "At left are sketches in two rows, probably connected with a picture representing the Virgin with the Child, and St. John. At right is a row with sketches for a flying angel. The lower part of the lowest row of the sketches has been cut away.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, white heightening on laid paper; Verso: Black chalk, pen and ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: J. Jorge Peoli; Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Architectural Fantasy: Buildings, Monuments and Stairways

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Staircases are leading up to the level of the structures from the lower level at the frontside. It is crossed at left by a bridge. Several groups of persons are upon the different levels and upon the staircases. Framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and red crayon with brown, gray and black washes on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A friar in the gesture of kneeling down, raising both arms and looking upwards.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum
The Upper Part of the Body of a Punchinello

label: Description
value: Shown in profile, turned toward left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink on thin paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum
Studies: Heads of a Boy and of a Girl

label: Description
value: Slightly lowered head of a boy shown in three-quarter profile turned toward left. The neck and a part of the butt is shown. On verso: unfinished neck and head of a girl, shown in profile turned toward right. Probably copied from an antique model.

label: Physical description
value: Red crayon on rough gray paper; on verso: white crayon

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Wearing a bonnet. Shown very obliquely, nearly in profile, turned toward left and lowered. Possibly a copy after Leonardo da Vinci.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum
Sketch for an Unused Scene for a Cartoon for Cotton Printing: La Vie de Bélisaire

label: Description
value: Sketch for one island for a cartoon for cotton printing, showing a blind soldier, staff in hand, holding a young boy on his left arm, while another soldier, nearby, expresses anguish. (Probably an unused island for a Belisarius subject; island shows the blind Belisarius being recognized by one of his soldiers.)

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink with gray wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum
Design for Ceiling Decoration, Probably the Muses

label: Description
value: At left is a woman playing a viola, at right another with a lute. In between are visible the heads of two more persons. A flying putto strews flowers. Framing ink line.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The bust and the right arm of the woman at left are turned toward the right; her head is turned to the spectator, the eyes are lowered. Her hair is styled as a "Toupée"; the ribbons of a cap are bound below the chin. The woman at right is turned toward the left, and seen nearly in profile. She wears a "dormeuse."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and red ink on paper, mounted on cardboard

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum
Six Men Standing or Walking in a Public Square of a Town

label: Description
value: In the center in front is a richly clad gentleman shown from the front side. Behind him are at left, another gentleman with a cape and a workman; at right, three figures. In the background are at left a church and a big mansion, but un-Venetian looking. Indication of the clouds.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, black chalk on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Circular cavetto, scalloped rim irregularly ten-sided. Chinoiserie decoration: seated man and boy holding parasol under double-roofed shelter supporting a bell and a bird, the whole surrounded by foliage. Border of alternating birds and green latticed panels.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shown standing with straddled legs from the frontside. He looks attentively to the left and takes something like a stone supported by his left hand with his right hand. He wears a high hat, a wrap with the shell around the shoulders, a tunic, bare legs, and high boots. The stick is lying behind him. Squared with black crayon for copying. At the reverse is, horizontally, in small size the head of a woman in pen.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and bistre on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Lying with erected upper part of the body, with the right arm leaning upon an elevation. The legs are at right, the head turned toward the right shoulder. Thee left arm is pointing. Scythe and hour-glass are at right. Framed by a stripe. Slightly altered copy of the crystal cut by Bernardi.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and bistre on paper, mounted on paper with red crayon drawing

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of young man turned toward viewer and sitting at a table. He wears pince-nez. Right hand raised holding pen, the left rests on paper.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Half figure intended to be made into a pin cushion, representing a woman shown to the waist with flange having three holes to which a skirt may be attached. The woman wears a green bodice, with long sleeves, low cut neck with purple ruffle and yellow scarf, a wreath of flowers in her hair and a rose in each hand.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Half figure intended to be made into a pin cushion, representing a woman shown to the waist with flange having three holes to which a skirt may be attached. The woman wears a tight fitting bodice with long sleeves, low square neck; ribbon scarf tied around neck; large hat (dress and hat are white with gilt trimming); a rose in each hand.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Mary is shown with outspread arms standing on a lunar crescent with a serpent wound around it. Four winged putti surround her and while holding on to her coat they carry her up into heaven.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk, graphite on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brisé fan with painted ivory sticks. Obverse: a gathering of women hunting water fowl; below are chinoiserie figures. Reverse: the same scene in reverse as a line drawing.

label: Physical description
value: Ivory sticks painted with gouache, silk ribbon
The Head of an Old Monk and the Head of a Child

value: The monk is at left, shown in profile, turned toward the left. The child was probably intended for a cherub.

Study for a Painting of Saint Anthony of Padua Holding the Infant Saint James Major or Saint Luis Gonzaga

label: Description
value: Saint Anthony stands in the center. A pilgrim, from whose girdle hangs a book and who bares his breast, is shown en face kneeling at left. Saint Luis is shown in profile, kneeling at right. Framing lines.
